      • home

        public void home​(Machine machine)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Perform the hardware homing operation. When this completes the axes should be at their homing location. The call might return before this physically happens, so a waitForCompletion() is needed if you need to be sure.
        Specified by:
        home in interface Driver
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setGlobalOffsets

        public void setGlobalOffsets​(Machine machine,
                             AxesLocation axesLocation)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Set the current physical axis positions to be reinterpreted as the specified coordinates. Used after visual homing and to reset a rotation angle after it has wrapped around. In G-Code parlance this is setting a global offset:
        Specified by:
        setGlobalOffsets in interface Driver
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getExactCommand

        public GcodeDriver.Command getExactCommand​(java.lang.String headMountableId,
                                           GcodeDriver.CommandType type)
        This is similar to the other getCommand calls, except the head mountable id is passed in and it must match exactly. By passing in null or "*", you will get a command that matches that head mountable id or null.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo​(HeadMountable hm,
                   Motion.MoveToCommand move)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Executes the given Motion.
        Specified by:
        moveTo in interface Driver
        Parameters:
        hm - The HeadMountable having triggered the move. This is mostly for proprietary machine driver support and might only be a stand-in in some motion blending scenarios.
        move - The moveTo Motion to execute, including target location and limits for feedrate, acceleration etc. as shaped by the MotionPlanner
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isMotionPending

        public boolean isMotionPending()
        Specified by:
        isMotionPending in interface Driver
        Returns:
        true if a motion is still assumed to be pending, i.e. waitForCompletion() has not yet been called.

      • waitForCompletion

        public void waitForCompletion​(HeadMountable hm,
                              MotionPlanner.CompletionType completionType)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Perform a coordinated wait for completion. This must be issued before capturing camera frames etc.
        Specified by:
        waitForCompletion in interface Driver
        Parameters:
        hm - The HeadMountable to wait for. If null, wait for all the axes on the driver. Most drivers/controllers will probably not be able to wait for just a sub-set of axes, so the'll wait for all the axes anyway.
        completionType - The kind of completion wanted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFeedRatePerSecond

        public Length getFeedRatePerSecond()
        Specified by:
        getFeedRatePerSecond in interface Driver
        Overrides:
        getFeedRatePerSecond in class AbstractDriver
        Returns:
        A driver specific feed-rate limit, applied in addition to axis feed-rate limits and according to NIST RS274NGC Interpreter - Version 3, Section 2.1.2.5 (p. 7). Given per second (will be converted to the standard per minute rate when using Gcode F values).

      • closeGcodeLogger

        protected void closeGcodeLogger()

      • detectFirmware

        public void detectFirmware​(boolean preserveOldValue,
                           boolean allowConnect)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Detect the firmware running on a controller using the M115 command. Also discover axes with M114. We want to do this very early in the machine setup, so the machine may not even be ready to be enabled. Instead just connect/disconnect this single driver.
        Parameters:
        preserveOldValue - preserve the old value if the detection fails.
        allowConnect - allow opening an ad hoc connection, if the machine is disabled.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • detectFirmwareSequence

        protected void detectFirmwareSequence()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFirmwareProperty

        public java.lang.String getFirmwareProperty​(java.lang.String name,
                                            java.lang.String defaultValue)

      • isSpeakingGcode

        public boolean isSpeakingGcode()
        Returns:
        true if this is a true Gcode speaking driver/controller rather than some other text protocol. In the absence of a detected firmware, the heuristic is simply to look for a G90 command.
